atmosphere.desc: Vacuum requires a vacc suit. The atmosphere has a pressure of less than 0.001 atmospheres, which requires the use of a vacc suit.
The atmosphere has a pressure of less than 0.1 atmospheres, which requires the use of a vacc suit.
Very Thin tainted requires a filter respirator combination.
The atmosphere has a pressure of 0.1 to 0.42 atmospheres, which requires the use of a respirator to ensure sufficient oxygen.
Tainted requires a filter mask. The atmosphere contains an unusual taint such as such as disease, a hazardous gas mix, pollutants, or sulfur compounds which requires the use of a filter mask.
No survival gear required. The atmosphere has a pressure of 0 43 to 0.70 atmospheres. The atmosphere is a standard oxygen/nitrogen mix, which is breathable without assistance.
No survival gear required. The atmosphere has a pressure of 0.71 to 1.49 atmospheres. The atmosphere is a standard oxygen/nitrogen mix, which is breathable without assistance.
No survival gear required. The atmosphere has a pressure of 1.50 to 2.49 atmospheres The atmosphere is a standard oxygen/nitrogen mix, which is breathable without assistance.
This type of atmosphere is unbreathable by humans, but is not otherwise hazardous. A Traveller needs an air supply to breath in an exotic atmosphere without suffocating.
Corrosive atmospheres are highly dangerous. A Traveller who breathes in a corrosive atmosphere will suffer 1D damage each round.

An insidious atmosphere is like a corrosive one, but it is so potent that it attacks equipment as well. The chief danger in an insidious atmosphere is that the toxic gases will destroy the seals and filters on the Travellerâ€™s protective gear. An insidious atmosphere worms its way past protection after 2D hours on average, although vigilant maintenance or advanced protective gear can prolong survival times.

These worlds have thick N2/O2 atmospheres, but their mean surface pressure is too high to support unprotected human life (high pressure nitrogen and oxygen are deadly to humans). However, pressure naturally decreases with increasing altitude, so if there are highlands at the right altitude the pressure may drop enough to support human life. Alternatively, there may not be any topography high enough for humans to inhabit, necessitating floating gravitic or dirigible habitats or sealed habitats on the surface.

The opposite of a Dense atmosphere, these massive worlds have thin N2/O2 atmospheres that settle in the lowlands and depressions and are only breathable there - the pressure drops off so rapidly with altitude that the highest topographic points of the surface may be close to vacuum.

An Unusual atmosphere is a catchall term for an atmosphere that behaves in a strange manner. Examples include ellipsoidal atmospheres, which are thin at the poles and dense at the equator; Panthalassic worlds composed of a rocky core surrounded by a water layer hundreds of kilometres thick; worlds wracked by storms so intense that local air pressure changes from dense to thin depending on the current weather and other planets with unusual and hazardous atmospheric conditions.

climate.desc: Frozen world. No liquid (surface) water, very dry atmosphere.
Icy world. Little liquid water, extensive ice caps, few clouds.
Temperate world. Earth-like. Liquid & vaporised water are common, moderate ice caps.
Hot world. Small or no ice caps, little liquid water. Most water in the form of clouds.
Boiling world. No ice caps, little liquid water.

population.desc: A small farmstead, hamlet, or a single family

government.desc: No government structure. In many cases, family bonds predominate
Ruling functions are assumed by a company managerial elite, and most citizenry are company employees or dependants
government.examples: Corporate outpost, asteroid mine, feudal domain

government.desc: Ruling functions are reached by the advice and consent of the citizenry directly
Ruling functions are performed by a restricted minority, with little or no input from the mass of citizenry
Ruling functions are performed by elected representatives
Ruling functions are performed by specific individuals for persons who agree to be ruled by them. Relationships are based on the performance of technical activities which are mutually beneficial
government.examples: Those with access to higher technology tend to have higher social status

government.desc: Ruling functions are performed by an imposed leadership answerable to an outside group
No central authority exists; rival governments complete for control. Law level refers to the government nearest the starport
Ruling functions are performed by government agencies employing individuals selected for their expertise
Ruling functions are performed by agencies which have become insulated from the governed citizens
government.examples: Entrenched castes of bureaucrats, decaying empire

government.desc: Ruling functions are performed by agencies directed by a single leader who enjoys the overwhelming confidence of the citizens
A previous charismatic dictator has been replaced by a leader through normal channels
Ruling functions are performed by a select group of members of an organisation or class which enjoys the overwhelming confidence of the citizenry
Ruling functions are performed by a religious organisation without regard to the specific individual needs of the citizenry
government.examples: Cult, transcendent philosophy, psionic group mind

government.desc: Government by a single religious leader having absolute power over the citizenry
Government by an all-powerful minority which maintains absolute control through widespread coercion and oppresion

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD
level.travellers: Visitors must contact planetary authorities by radio, landing is permitted anywhere
level.powers: Dangerous special powers must be registered.

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, Heavy weapons, armed vehicles
level.information: Dangerous technologies such as nanotechnology, Intrusion programs
level.travellers: Visitors must report passenger manifest, landing is permitted anywhere
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; use of dangerous powers forbidden

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, Heavy weapons, armed vehicles, Portable energy weapons (except ship-mounted weapons)
level.information: Dangerous technologies such as nanotechnology, Intrusion programs, Agent programs
level.travellers: Visitors must report passenger manifest, Landing only at starport or other authorized sites
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; use of dangerous powers forbidden, Use of telepathy restricted to government-approved individuals

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, Heavy weapons, armed vehicles, Portable energy weapons (except ship-mounted weapons), Light assault weapons and submachine guns
level.information: Dangerous technologies such as nanotechnology, Intrusion programs, Agent programs, Security programs
level.travellers: Visitors must report passenger manifest, Landing only at starport
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; use of dangerous powers forbidden, Use of telepathy restricted to government-approved individuals, Use of teleportation and clairvoyance restricted

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, Heavy weapons, armed vehicles, Portable energy weapons (except ship-mounted weapons), Light assault weapons and submachine guns, Personal concealable weapons
level.information: Dangerous technologies such as nanotechnology, Intrusion programs, Agent programs, Security programs, Expert programs
level.travellers: Citizens must register offworld travel, visitors must register all business, Landing only at starport
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; Use of all special powers restricted to government specialists

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, All firearms (energy included) except shotguns and stunners; carrying weapons strongly discouraged
level.drugs: Combat drugs, Addictive narcotics, Anagathics, Fast and Slow drugs
level.information: Dangerous technologies such as nanotechnology, Intrusion programs, Agent programs, Security programs, Expert programs, Recent news from offworld
level.travellers: Citizens must register offworld travel, visitors must register all business, Landing only at starport, Visits discouraged; excessive contact with citizens forbidden
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; Use of all special powers restricted to government specialists; Possession of power-related drugs banned

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, Portable energy weapons, ship-mounted weapons, All firearms except stunners; carrying weapons strongly discouraged
level.drugs: Combat drugs, Anagathics, Fast and Slow drugs, All narcotics
level.information: Dangerous technologies such as nanotechnology, Intrusion programs, Agent programs, Security programs, Expert programs, Library programs, unfiltered data about other worlds, free speech curtailed
level.travellers: Visitors must register all business, Landing only at starport, Citizens may not leave planet; visitors may not leave starport
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; Use of special powers forbidden; Possession of power-related drugs banned

level.weapons: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD, Portable energy weapons, ship-mounted weapons, All firearms including stunners, All bladed weapons; carrying weapons strongly discouraged
level.drugs: Combat drugs, Anagathics, Fast and Slow drugs, All narcotics, Medicinal drugs
level.information: All Information technology, any non-critical data from offworld, personal media
level.powers: All special powers must be registered; Power-related technology and equipment banned

level.information: All Information technology, Any data from offworld, no free press
level.powers: All special powers, and related persons, drugs and equipment

level.information: All Information technology, Paper media, free speech
level.powers: All special powers, and related persons, drugs and equipment

transport.land: Advanced Wheel - Moveable Axle, Replaceable Rims, Stagecoaches
transport.water: Early Multi-Mast Sailing, Oceangoing sailing ships, Crude Navigation

general.environment: Cities in Rugged/Desert Terrain, Crude Terraform

transport.water: Personal Self-Propelled Boats, Steel hulls, Early Submersibles

military.personalweapons: RAM Grenade Launchers, Early Laser Carbine

general.computing: Non-Volatile / High Data, Vocal I/O, Model/3

transport.land: Early Grav Vehicles, Ultra High-Speed Trains

general.medicine: Antiviral Vaccines, Cancer Cure, Growth Quickining

general.computing: Synaptic Learning Processors, Hand Computers, Model/5

transport.land: Personal Grav Belts, LT Grav Modules
transport.water: Personal Grav Belts, LT Grav Modules
transport.air: Personal Grav Belts, LT Grav Modules

general.computing: Holocrystal Storage, High Autonomous Robots, Model/7

transport.space: Grav Vehicles Merge with Orbital Spacecraft, Jump-4

general.computing: Low Artificial Intelligence, Robots in all Facets

transport.space: Grav Vehicles, Jump-6, Raw Material Only Short Range Matter Transport
Grav Vehicles, Jump-6, Inanimate Only Short Range Matter Transport
Grav Vehicles, Jump-6, Self-Aware Starships, living being portal based Matter Transport

tradecode.name: Agricultural
tradecode.desc: Dedicated to farming and food production. Often, they are divided into vast semi-feudal estates.

tradecode.name: Asteroid
tradecode.desc: Usually mining colonies, but can also be orbital factories or colonies.

tradecode.name: Fluid Oceans
tradecode.desc: Worlds where the surface liquid is something other than water, and so are incompatible with Earth-derived life.

tradecode.name: High Technology
tradecode.desc: Among the most technologically advanced in Charted Space.

tradecode.name: Ice-Capped
tradecode.desc: Worlds that have most of their surface liquid frozen in polar ice caps, and are cold and dry.

tradecode.name: Low Population
tradecode.desc: A population of only a few thousand or less.

tradecode.name: Low Technology
tradecode.desc: Pre-industrial and cannot produce advanced goods.

tradecode.name: Non-Agricultural
tradecode.desc: Too dry or barren to support their populations using conventional food production.

tradecode.name: Non-Industrial
tradecode.desc: Too low in population to maintain an extensive industrial base.

tradecode.name: Poor
tradecode.desc: Lacking resources, viable land or suficient population to be anything other than marginal colonies.

tradecode.name: Rich
tradecode.desc: Blessed with a stable government and viable biosphere, making them economic powerhouses.

tradecode.name: Water World
tradecode.desc: Almost entirely water-ocean across their surface.

culture.quirk: One gender is considered subservient or inferior to the other.
Culture is heavily influenced by a religion or belief systems, possibly one unique to this world.
Art and culture are highly prized. Aesthetic design is important in all artefacts produced on world.
Social interaction and trade is highly formalized. Politeness and adherence to traditional forms is considered very important.
The culture resists change and outside influences.
The culture distrusts outsiders and alien influences. Offworlders will face considerable prejudice.
A particular topic is forbidden and cannot be discussed. Travellers who unwittingly mention this topic will be ostracized.
Trickery and equivocation are considered acceptable. Honesty is a sign of weakness.
The culture welcomes change and offworld influence. Travellers who bring new and strange ideas will be welcomed.
Oneâ€™s word is oneâ€™s bond in the culture. Lying is both rare and despised.
The culture is heavily influenced by another, neighboring world. Roll again for a cultural quirk that has been inherited from the culture.
The culture is a merger of two distinct cultures. Roll again twice to determine the quirks inherited from these cultures. If the quirks are incompatible, then the culture is likely divided.

Physical strength and combat prowess are highly valued in the culture. Travellers may be challenged to a fight, or dismissed if they seem incapable of defending themselves. Sports tend towards the bloody and violent.
The culture is a surviving remnant of a once-great and vibrant civilization, clinging to its former glory. The world is filled with crumbling ruins, and every story revolves around the good old days.
The culture is falling apart and is on the brink of war or economic collapse. Violent protests are common, and the social order is decaying.
The culture is expanding and vibrant. Fortunes are being made in trade; science is forging bravely ahead.
A recent trauma, such as a plague, war, disaster or despotic regime has left scars on the culture.
Members of many different cultures and species visit here.
Some aspect of the culture or the planet draws visitors from all over charted space.
Physical conflict is common, taking the form of duels, brawls or other contests. Trial by combat is a part of their judicial system.
Physical conflict is almost unheardof. The culture produces few soldiers, and diplomacy reigns supreme. Forceful Travellers will be ostracized.
Everyone is obsessed with or addicted to a substance, personality, act or item. This monomania pervades every aspect of the culture.
Fine clothing and decoration are considered vitally important in the culture. Underdressed Travellers have no standing here.
The culture is at war, either with another planet or polity, or is troubled by terrorists or rebels.
Space travellers hold a unique position in the cultureâ€™s mythology or beliefs, and travellers will be expected to live up to these myths.
The planetâ€™s starport is more than a commercial center; it might be a religious temple, or be seen as highly controversial and surrounded by protesters.
News agencies and telecommunications channels are especially strange here. Getting accurate information may be difficult.
The culture interacts with technology in an unusual way. Telecommunications might be banned, robots might have civil rights, or cyborgs might be property.
There might be a mandatory age of termination, or anagathics might be widely used. Family units might be different, with children being raised by the state or banned in favor of cloning.
The culture has a distinct caste system. Travellers of a low social standing who do not behave appropriately will face punishment.

The culture has an odd attitude towards some aspect of commerce, which may interfere with trade at the spaceport. For example, merchants might expect a gift as part of a deal, or some goods may only be handled by certain families.
Those of high social standing have a strange custom associated with them; perhaps nobles are blinded, or must live in gilded cages, or only serve for a single year before being exiled.
The culture has an unusual attitude towards intercourse and reproduction. Perhaps cloning is used instead, or sex is used to seal commercial deals.
Food and drink occupies an unusual place in the culture. Perhaps eating is a private affair, or banquets and formal dinners are seen as the highest form of politeness.
Travellers may be distrusted or feted, or perhaps the culture frowns on those who leave their homes.
Something strange is going on. The government is being subverted by another group or agency.

class.name: O
class.desc: Very hot and very luminous, being bluish in color; in fact, most of their output is in the ultraviolet range. These are the rarest of all main sequence stars, constituting as few as 1 in 3,000,000 in the solar neighborhood O-stars shine with a power over a million times our Sun's output. Because they are so huge, class O stars burn through their hydrogen fuel very quickly, and are the first stars to leave the main sequence.

class.name: B
class.desc: Extremely luminous and blue. As O and B stars are so powerful, they only live for a very short time, and thus they do not stray far from the area in which they were formed. These stars tend to cluster together in what are called OB associations, which are associated with giant molecular clouds. The Orion OB1 association occupies a large portion of a spiral arm of our galaxy and contains many of the brighter stars of the constellation Orion. They constitute about 1 in 800 main sequence stars in the solar neighborhood.

class.name: A
class.desc: Amongst the more common naked eye stars, and are white or bluish-white. They comprise about 1 in 160 of the main sequence stars in the solar neighborhood.

class.name: F
class.desc: These stars' color is white with a slight tinge of yellow. These represent about 1 in 32 of the main sequence stars in the solar neighborhood.

class.name: G
class.desc: The best known, if only for the reason that Sol (Terra) is of this class. Supergiant stars often swing between O or B (blue) and K or M (red). While they do this, they do not stay for long in the G classification as this is an extremely unstable place for a supergiant to be. G stars represent about 1 in 13 of the main sequence stars in the solar neighborhood.

class.name: K
class.desc: Orangish stars which are slightly cooler than our Sun. Some K stars are giants and supergiants, such as Arcturus, while others, like Alpha Centauri B, are main sequence stars. These make up 1 in 8 of the main sequence stars in the solar neighborhood.

class.name: M
class.desc: By far the most common class. At least 80% of the main sequence stars in the solar neighborhood are red dwarfs such as Proxima Centauri. M is also host to most giants and some supergiants such as Antares and Betelgeuse , as well as Mira variables. The late-M group holds hotter brown dwarfs that are above the L spectrum. This is usually in the range of M6.5 to M9.5.
